title: New York City Mayor Unveils Plans to Curb Gun Crimes
sub_head: Community investment, redeployment of police part of plan to combat surge of gun violence in the city
body:
New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio on Tuesday unveiled new initiatives aimed at reducing an uptick in gun violence that has plagued the city over the past year.
The initiative, dubbed “Safe Summer NYC,” focuses on community investment, redeploying police officers and improvements within the court system, the mayor said at a press conference.
“We know that investing in our young people makes a huge difference,” the mayor said. “We know that part of the strategy to keep people safe, an essential part, is bringing community and police together.”
The announcement comes as the city grapples with a surge of gun violence unlike anything it has seen in the last 20 years, after bringing crime down to record lows.
Mr. de Blasio, a Democrat, has pointed to the Covid-19 pandemic as one reason for the increase. Police officials have also pointed to gangs and youth-lead crews for many of the shootings.
